description: recto: two women standing against wall on city street with carriage at right; woman at right faces forward, with her hands on her hips, looking sideways at her companion; both women wear bonnets; woman at right wears dark cape--woman at left has her cape over her PR arm and leans on a folded parasol; verso: frowning woman kneeling on a cushion-covered stool while a woman behind her places a dark hat on her head; woman at left reading from a book, standing behind a counter with a pair of small floral arrangements; two other women and right hold beribboned poles
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [(illegible) 33] and [54 (?--upside down)]
markings: on back, stamped in red: [ATELIER / ED. DEGAS]
provenance: Edgar Degas, L.657 (1834-1917), Paris. [Eric G. Carlson Fine Prints and Drawings, New York, until 2006; sold in August for NRL.TO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2006-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Le meme jour, ma chére! me laisser siffler deux hommes, dieu!
